snippet: A race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched heartland, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests that use the water-intensive hydraulic fracturing process.
abstract: New race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched West, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests that use the water-intensive hydraulic fracturing process; farmers and environmental activists are worried that deep-pocketed energy companies will have purchasing advantage for increasingly scarce water supplies as they drill deep new wells.
lead_paragraph: A race for water is rippling through the drought-scorched heartland, pitting farmers against oil and gas interests that use the water-intensive hydraulic fracturing process.

headline.seo: Struggle for Water in Colorado With Rise in Fracking
headline.main: For Farms in the West, Oil Wells Are Thirsty Rivals
headline.print_headline: Option for Drilling Pits Farmers Against Water-Thirsty Oil Wells
